oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dynamics and Significance of Mastitis in Beef Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Timms, Leo L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: milk production
calf preweaning-weight gains
Mastitis
milk quantity
quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The greatest single factor affecting calf preweaning-weight gains is milk production by the dam. Mastitis is the most costly disease in dairy cattle, and has been shown to significantly decrease milk quantity and quality.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1993; 108
